title: Donate blood and Save Life
subtitle: Donate for the Mankind
about_data: Including volunteers and many organisations, the Hadia Blood Organization is a countrywide non-profit, non-political organisation. The organization's primary goal is to raise public awareness and increase the number of potential blood donors. Our mission is to spread awareness about secure, long-lasting blood programmes across the nation. To raise awareness about blood transfusions, we are a group of university graduates who are concerned non-medical workers founded the Hadia blood organisation. Patients with Thalassemia, Hemophilia, and other blood disorders will receive quality, comprehensive care from Hadia Blood Organization free of cost. In addition to resolving the medical and social problems that Thalassemia and Hemophilia sufferers face, we also follow our moral obligation to raise awareness of the condition and prevent it from spreading to newly born children.
about_heading: You don't have to be a doctor to Save lives!
about_span1: Blood is the most precious gift that anyone can give to another person.
about_span2: Donating blood not only saves the life also save donor's lives.
what_is_blood_des: Blood is essential to life. Blood circulates through our body and delivers essential substances like oxygen and nutrients to the body’s cells. It also transports metabolic waste products away from those same cells. There is no substitute for blood. It cannot be made or manufactured. Generous blood donors are the only source of blood for patients in need of a blood transfusion. Red blood cells represent 40%-45% of your blood volume. They are generated from your bone marrow at a rate of four to five billion per hour. They have a lifecycle of about 120 days in the body. Plasma is the liquid portion of your blood. Plasma is yellowish in color and is made up mostly of water, but it also contains proteins, sugars, hormones and salts. It transports water and nutrients to your body’s tissues
why_donate_blood_des: Voluntary blood donations during these two years have been decreasing, and the Donate Blood application will significantly help the Blood Transfusion Institute to achieve its mission  to save lives and treat patients.The Donate Blood unique platform was created within the CoronaThon competition, which was organized by UNDP in Montenegro and partners in April 2020. The development of the platform was logistically and financially supported by the UNDP, it was stated during the presentation. The mobile application for Android and iOS devices will increase the awareness of voluntary blood donors about current stocks and enable them to schedule blood donation. Blood is needed in emergencies to save the lives of people with diseases such as leukemia, thalassemia, and bleeding disorders, and those who have undergone major surgery.
who_can_donate_desc1: Who can donate blood? If you are healthy, you can donate blood. To become a blood donor, you need to meet some basic requirements. Below are some basic eligibility criteria.
who_can_donate_desc2: They are between the ages of 18 and 65. In some countries, national law allows children aged 16 to 17 years to donate if they meet and agree to their physical and hematological requirements.
who_can_donate_desc3: You must weigh at least 50 kilogrammes. In some countries, whole blood donors must weigh at least 45 kg in order to donate 350 ml (10%).
who_can_donate_desc4: When people donate blood at a blood service in a particular country, they must meet national qualification standards. Contact your national / local blood service to determine if your medical condition, medication, profession, or travel experience may limit your ability to donate blood.
financial_support: Financially support us for holding camps and save a human life.
your_privacy_will_be_preserved: Note : Your privacy will be preserved
partner_heading: Help us do good to everyone!
partner_desc: Every two minutes, someone in Pakistan needs blood. Don't be afraid of donating blood, it’s a very fast and safe process. And it's anoble thing to feel proud about.
partner_desc2: Holding a blood donation camp in your area or at your education institute, will help a lot in the community to recognize you as a leader. Also, holding blood donation camps will also contribute to the safe and consistent supply of blood for patients in your community.
before_desc: Every donor's hemoglobin and blood group were tested on the day of the blood donation camp. Males and females needed to have a hemoglobin of at least 13 gm percent and 12 gm percent, respectively, to give blood.
during_desc: Motivate the public to donate blood by oral communication, which is the most effective method of recruiting donors.Guide the camp organizer, medical officer, and also other team members involving in voluntary blood donation camp to organize the camp efficiently.
after_desc: Allow the donor to sit in the refreshment area under supervision and be provided some light refreshments after the donation. Donors should be encouraged to stay in the refreshment room for at least 15 minutes, drink more water throughout the day, and stop from smoking for at least half an hour.
who_can_hold_donations: Who Can Hold Blood Donation Camps
who_can_hold_donations_desc: Our group can roll up everywhere there are blood donors willing to save lives, from schools to workplaces, religious institutions to community events.To organize blood donation camps, there are certain things you need to do. Firstly you have to submit complete documentation about the place. After approval our representative will visit your place and verify your provided information. If approved, you can hold blood donation camp.
